intro: Elatostema dissectoides, commonly known as the narrow-leaf false shamrock, is a herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes nettles and related plants. The plant features small, heart-shaped leaves that are often divided into narrow segments, giving it a delicate appearance. It produces tiny greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Elatostema dissectoides is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive foliage and ease of cultivation.
